block.p: LEAD: International A3-13 Panama's coup leaders were divided over what to do with General Noriega when he was a prisoner, the Pentagon said in a move to head off criticism from rebels in Miami. Page A1 Panama captain buried amid execution reports A10 Two pardoned Argentines return

LEAD: International A3-13 Panama's coup leaders were divided over what to do with General Noriega when he was a prisoner, the Pentagon said in a move to head off criticism from rebels in Miami. Page A1 Panama captain buried amid execution reports A10 Two pardoned Argentines return

International A3-13 Panama's coup leaders were divided over what to do with General Noriega when he was a prisoner, the Pentagon said in a move to head off criticism from rebels in Miami. Page A1 Panama captain buried amid execution reports A10 Two pardoned Argentines return A5 South Africa will free Walter Sisulu and six other leaders of the banned African National Congress, but will not immediately release Nelson Mandela, President de Klerk said. A1 Some southern African nations oppose ban on ivory trading A8 News analysis: East German events are cooling as protests and anniversary celebrations recede. Now divisions are appearing within the Communist Party over reform. A1 What's in a name? Just ask Hungary's redesignated Socialists A9 Nationalists will end an embargo in Azerbaijan that has deprived neighboring Armenia of fuel and supplies for two months. A potentially dangerous impasse is apparently ended. A6 U.F.O. landing is fact, not fantasy, Russians insist A6 The next Chinese leader was picked by the Communist Party. It said Jiang Zemin would be the ''core'' of a third generation of leaders, thereby succeeding Deng Xiaoping. A3 Indonesia moving toward a more private economy A13 An Egyptian-Israeli meeting in Washington is being sought by Secretary Baker to pave the way for Israeli-Palestinian talks. A3 Beit Sahur journal: A tax war develops on the West Bank A4 A French researcher was overlooked in the awarding of this year's Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, French scientists say. But Americans say he played only a minor role A8 Bush to attend Latin drug talks A10 U.N. shuns drug fight A12 National A14-28 Florida will not pass abortion limits sought by the Governor, top legislators said as they opened a special session on abortion and demonstrators marched on Tallahassee. A1 Supreme Court roundup: Abortion foes lose plea for hearing A23 Court to consider the scope of a generic drug law D2 A bidding war of bigger tax breaks broke out in the Senate as sponsors of competing proposals for a cut in the capital gains tax sought the 60 votes needed to overcome parliamentary obstacles. A1 New oil drilling would be banned off the California coast, some pesticides would be phased out and carbon dioxide emissions would be cut by 40 percent under a ballot measure proposed in California. A1 More companies to phase out ozone-destroying chemicals A27 The Bay Area has a chance to crow to New York and Los Angeles as San Francisco and Oakland become the homes of the World Series. A1 A plea to block a shuttle launching Thursday that is to carry nuclear-powered cargo was rejected by a judge. NASA delayed the launching because of an engine problem. A18 Jury to decide fault in '87 jet crash in Detroit A17 Child care may become more costly under a change in the Federal tax law. The change is meant to cut back the practice of paying child-care providers off the books. A14 Chicago parents vied for votes on the eve of an election to chose who will run the third-largest and newly decentralized school system. A18 Charleston will not suffer damage over the long run because of Hurricane Hugo's foray into South Carolina, Mayor Joseph Riley said. A21 Four aliens found dead in fumigated truck trailer A14 Man guilty of planting 13 bombs in Indiana city A16 Blown fuse blamed for slow response in Norfolk, Va., fire A21 Pentagon softens stand on control of Stars and Stripes A20 MGM/UA deal collapses D1 Regional B1-5, B24 New York City tax revenue lagged well behind expectations in the last three months and, in some cases, dropped sharply from the same period last year, officials say. B1 Governor Cuomo is being chided by critics for urging ''spending discipline'' in his New York State budget but complaining bitterly when President Bush uses a similar theme. B3 Giuliani ties strong city economy to helping the poor B4 Is Rudolph Giuliani a Reaganite? The Dinkins campaign says that Mr. Giuliani's work for the Reagan Administration amounts to an endorsement of many of its policies. The Giuliani campaign disputes that view. B1 Mayoral camps meeting today on debate plan B4 Finance law evens the odds in New Jersey governor race B1 A helicopter crashed in New Jersey, killing five people, including three top executives of Donald Trump's three casinos in Atlantic City. B1 Hospitals shouldn't rely on New York for any ''big bailouts'' and instead should take steps on their own to reduce costs, the New York State Health Commissioner said. B24 A housing manager was transferred after he warned officials in the New York City Housing Authority of suspected corruption, the Department of Investigation said. B5 Suspect is identified in beating of Jewish students B3 Water-main break spews asbestos into 8th Avenue B3
